options.query:
`applocker` 
| spath input=UserData_Xml path=RuleAndFileData.PolicyName output=PolicyName
| spath input=UserData_Xml path=RuleAndFileData.RuleId output=RuleId
| spath input=UserData_Xml path=RuleAndFileData.RuleName output=RuleName
| spath input=UserData_Xml path=RuleAndFileData.RuleSddl output=RuleSddl
| spath input=UserData_Xml path=RuleAndFileData.TargetUser output=TargetUser
| spath input=UserData_Xml path=RuleAndFileData.TargetProcessId output=TargetProcessId
| spath input=UserData_Xml path=RuleAndFileData.FilePath output=FilePath
| spath input=UserData_Xml path=RuleAndFileData.Fqbn output=Fqbn
| spath input=UserData_Xml path=RuleAndFileData.TargetLogonId output=TargetLogonId
| spath input=UserData_Xml path=RuleAndFileData.FullFilePath output=FullFilePath
| search PolicyName=*
| table PolicyName, RuleId, RuleName, RuleSddl, TargetUser, TargetProcessId, FilePath, Fqbn, TargetLogonId, FullFilePath _time

`applocker`

| eval EventType=case(
    EventCode==8000, "PolicyApplicationFailure",
    EventCode==8001, "PolicyApplicationSuccess",
    EventCode==8002, "AllowedFileExecution",
    EventCode==8003, "AuditedFileExecution",
    EventCode==8004, "BlockedFileExecution",
    EventCode==8005, "AllowedScriptOrMSIExecution",
    EventCode==8006, "AuditedScriptOrMSIExecution",
    EventCode==8007, "BlockedScriptOrMSIExecution",
    EventCode==8020, "AllowedPackagedApp",
    EventCode==8021, "AuditedPackagedApp",
    EventCode==8022, "DisabledPackagedApp",
    EventCode==8023, "AllowedPackagedAppInstallation",
    EventCode==8024, "AuditedPackagedAppInstallation",
    EventCode==8025, "DisabledPackagedAppInstallation",
    EventCode==8027, "NoPackagedAppRule"
)
| table _time, host, EventCode, EventType
| stats values(EventType) values(EventCode) count by host

`applocker`
| spath input=UserData_Xml | rename RuleAndFileData.* as *
| lookup applockereventcodes EventCode OUTPUT Description
|  search  PolicyName=$policyname$ EventCode=$eventcode$
| stats values(host) AS dest by PolicyName, EventCode, Description, RuleId, RuleName, RuleSddl, TargetUser, TargetProcessId, FilePath, Fqbn, TargetLogonId, FullFilePath _time

`applocker` EventCode IN (8007, 8004, 8022, 8025, 8029, 8040)
| spath input=UserData_Xml | rename RuleAndFileData.* as *
| lookup applockereventcodes EventCode OUTPUT Description
| stats count

`applocker` EventCode IN (8003, 8006, 8021, 8024, 8039)
| spath input=UserData_Xml | rename RuleAndFileData.* as *
| lookup applockereventcodes EventCode OUTPUT Description
| stats count

`applocker` EventCode IN (8002, 8005, 8020, 8023, 8033, 8037)
| spath input=UserData_Xml | rename RuleAndFileData.* as *
| lookup applockereventcodes EventCode OUTPUT Description
| stats count

options.markdown:
## AppLocker Event Code Reference
- `8000` - Policy Application Failure: Indicates a problem with applying the policy.
- `8001` - Policy Application Success: The policy has been applied successfully.
- `8002` - Allowed File Execution: A file was allowed to run.
- `8003` - Audited File Execution: A file was executed and logged for audit purposes.
- `8004` - Blocked File Execution: A file was blocked from running.
- `8005` - Allowed Script Or MSI Execution: A script or MSI was allowed to run.
- `8006` - Audited Script Or MSI Execution: A script or MSI was executed and logged for audit purposes.
- `8007` - Blocked Script Or MSI Execution: A script or MSI was blocked from running.
- `8020` - Allowed Packaged App: A packaged app was allowed to run.
- `8021` - Audited Packaged App: A packaged app was executed and logged for audit purposes.
- `8022` - Disabled Packaged App: A packaged app was disabled from running.
- `8023` - Allowed Packaged App Installation: Installation of a packaged app was permitted.
- `8024` - Audited Packaged App Installation: Installation of a packaged app was audited.
- `8025` - Disabled Packaged App Installation: Installation of a packaged app was disabled.
- `8027` - No Packaged App Rule: No applicable rule was found for a packaged app.

title: AppLocker
description: Utilize this dashboard to assist with auditing and monitoring Windows AppLocker events for your endpoints. Configure the applocker macro to use the AppLocker data source for populating the dashboard.
